sentence: The dataset contains biaxial mechanical tests of six tissue specimens (n = 6) for each of the atrioventricular heart valve leaflets (MVAL: MVAL1.txt—MVAL6.txt, Fig. 1, MVPL: MVPL1.txt—MVPL6.txt, Fig. 2, TVAL: TVAL1.txt—TVAL6.txt, Fig. 3, TVPL: TVPL1.txt—TVPL6.txt, Fig. 4, and TVSL: TVSL1.txt, TVSL6.txt, Fig. 5).

Open in a new tab
First Piola Kirchhoff stress versus stretch responses of the six MVAL tissue specimens under various biaxial mechanical loading (P11:P22 ratios of 1:1, 0.75:1, 1:0.75, 0.5:1, and 1:0.5).Fig. 2.

Open in a new tab
First Piola Kirchhoff stress versus stretch responses of the six MVPL tissue specimens under various biaxial mechanical loading (P11:P22 ratios of 1:1, 0.75:1, 1:0.75, 0.5:1, and 1:0.5).Fig. 3.

Open in a new tab
First Piola Kirchhoff stress versus stretch responses of the six TVAL tissue specimens under various biaxial mechanical loading (P11:P22 ratios of 1:1, 0.75:1, 1:0.75, 0.5:1, and 1:0.5).Fig. 4.

Open in a new tab
First Piola Kirchhoff stress versus stretch responses of the six TVPL tissue specimens under various biaxial mechanical loading (P11:P22 ratios of 1:1, 0.75:1, 1:0.75, 0.5:1, and 1:0.5).Fig. 5.

To avoid the Saint-Venant effects on tissue deformations during our biaxial mechanical testing [2], four glass beads, served as fiducial markers, were placed in the central delimited region (3 mm × 3 mm) of the valve leaflet specimen (Fig. 2c from the companion journal article [1]).

For more information on the experimental procedures employed and stress and strain calculations, please refer to Section 2 and Fig. 1, Fig. 2 from the companion journal article [1].Acknowledgements
Support from the American Heart Association Scientist Development Grant (SDG) Award (16SDG27760143) is gratefully acknowledged.

The dataset contains biaxial mechanical tests of six tissue specimens (n = 6) for each of the atrioventricular heart valve leaflets (MVAL: MVAL1.txt—MVAL6.txt, Fig. 1, MVPL: MVPL1.txt—MVPL6.txt, Fig. 2, TVAL: TVAL1.txt—TVAL6.txt, Fig. 3, TVPL: TVPL1.txt—TVPL6.txt, Fig. 4, and TVSL: TVSL1.txt, TVSL6.txt, Fig. 5).

First Piola Kirchhoff stress versus stretch responses of the six TVPL tissue specimens under various biaxial mechanical loading (P11:P22 ratios of 1:1, 0.75:1, 1:0.75, 0.5:1, and 1:0.5).Fig. 5.

To avoid the Saint-Venant effects on tissue deformations during our biaxial mechanical testing [2], four glass beads, served as fiducial markers, were placed in the central delimited region (3 mm × 3 mm) of the valve leaflet specimen (Fig. 2c from the companion journal article [1]).

For more information on the experimental procedures employed and stress and strain calculations, please refer to Section 2 and Fig. 1, Fig. 2 from the companion journal article [1].Acknowledgements
Support from the American Heart Association Scientist Development Grant (SDG) Award (16SDG27760143) is gratefully acknowledged.

The dataset contains biaxial mechanical tests of six tissue specimens (n = 6) for each of the atrioventricular heart valve leaflets (MVAL: MVAL1.txt—MVAL6.txt, Fig. 1, MVPL: MVPL1.txt—MVPL6.txt, Fig. 2, TVAL: TVAL1.txt—TVAL6.txt, Fig. 3, TVPL: TVPL1.txt—TVPL6.txt, Fig. 4, and TVSL: TVSL1.txt, TVSL6.txt, Fig. 5).

To avoid the Saint-Venant effects on tissue deformations during our biaxial mechanical testing [2], four glass beads, served as fiducial markers, were placed in the central delimited region (3 mm × 3 mm) of the valve leaflet specimen (Fig. 2c from the companion journal article [1]).
For more information on the experimental procedures employed and stress and strain calculations, please refer to Section 2 and Fig. 1, Fig. 2 from the companion journal article [1].

To avoid the Saint-Venant effects on tissue deformations during our biaxial mechanical testing [2], four glass beads, served as fiducial markers, were placed in the central delimited region (3 mm × 3 mm) of the valve leaflet specimen (Fig. 2c from the companion journal article [1]).
For more information on the experimental procedures employed and stress and strain calculations, please refer to Section 2 and Fig. 1, Fig. 2 from the companion journal article [1].

For more information on the experimental procedures employed and stress and strain calculations, please refer to Section 2 and Fig. 1, Fig. 2 from the companion journal article [1].
